issue.title: Current "main" branch: tests hang in test_free()
issue.body:
MacOS Catalina 10.15.7, Xcode-12.2.

Config:
```
env RUN_TESTS_PARALLEL_UPPER=FALSE cmake -GNinja .. -DOQS_USE_OPENSSL=ON -DOQS_USE_CPU_EXTENSIONS=ON -DBUILD_SHARED_LIBS=OFF -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=/opt/local -DOQS_KEM_DEFAULT="OQS_KEM_alg_ntru_hps4096821" -DOQS_SIG_DEFAULT="OQS_SIG_alg_falcon_1024" -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release
```

issue.title: Template casing error results in malformed name for SIKE_P434_COMPRESSED algorithm.
issue.body:
openssh/oqs-template/**generate.yml**

   NAME: "SIKE_P434_COMPRESSED"

'NAME' should be lowercase, as the other instances. When the templates are generated, the name for this algorithm is malformed.

For example, in myproposal.h:

#define KEX_PQ_METHOD_SIKE \
    PQ_OQS_KEX_METHOD("sike-p434-sha384") \
    PQ_OQS_KEX_METHOD("sike-p503-sha384") \
    PQ_OQS_KEX_METHOD("sike-p610-sha384") \
    PQ_OQS_KEX_METHOD("sike-p751-sha384") \
    PQ_OQS_KEX_METHOD("-sha384") \   <------------------------------------------ here
    PQ_OQS_KEX_METHOD("sike-p503-compressed-sha384") \
    PQ_OQS_KEX_METHOD("sike-p610-compressed-sha384") \
    PQ_OQS_KEX_METHOD("sike-p751-compressed-sha384")

Using lowercase 'name' and regenerating the templates fixes this issue.

issue.title: Unintended cmake build logic resulting from misspellings of OQS_PORTABLE_BUILD
issue.body:
In:
liboqs/src/common/CMakeLists.txt
liboqs/src/kem/bike/CMakeLists.txt

There are three total instances of **OQS_PORTABLE_BUILD** being spelled as **OQS_BUILD_PORTABLE**

**OQS_PORTABLE_BUILD** is defined and is ON, by default.
**OQS_BUILD_PORTABLE** is not defined anywhere and is, by default, OFF

The build logic that mistakenly uses **OQS_BUILD_PORTABLE** is building as a non-portable build in all cases.

Fixing these instances, results in the tests failing to link as the sha3/sha3x4.c sha-3 implementation would no longer be the default on portable builds.

issue.title: creating a new stable release snapshot ?
issue.body:
Will you create another stable release snapshot before merging in 1.1.1i?
last snapshot was on Aug 11, a while ago.

comment.body:
We talked about this in our status meeting today and the consensus was that now is not the right time for a liboqs 0.5.0 release, since we have some but not all Round 3 implementations in right now.  As a result that would also mean not tagging an OpenSSL release now.

Our continuous integration tests for liboqs trigger OpenSSL builds as well, so if the goal is to have a known liboqs/OpenSSL pair that work together consistently, it would be possible to determine commit IDs of such pairs from the past week.

thanks for update.

issue.title: Constants for compressed SIKE-P434 pure and hybrid key exchange algorithms are incorrectly named
issue.body:
This looks like a problem with the template. Where `SIKE_P434_COMPRESSED` or `sike-p434-compressed` should appear in the code as an identifier or part of a string, respectively, it is absent. This results in:

https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh/blob/af67d4ec892fba08b7d7071ea8b3efc675237911/kex.h#L119
https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh/blob/af67d4ec892fba08b7d7071ea8b3efc675237911/kex.h#L185

These constants and strings still end up being consistent across the code base so it still builds (and presumably works), so nothing's broken, but this should still be fixed.
